content.description: Start with both hands on a large edge on the lower left side of the boulder.  Traverse up and to the right over the tallest part of the boulder.
content.protection: Multiple pads and spotter.  The landing is pretty sketchy no matter how many pads you have. It is better to just not fall.
content.location: It is located at the base of Punishment Wall. There is a large boulder right before you reach the wall itself.

content.description: This is a fun route navigating a dihedral to a thin crack and finally face climbing with solid jugs to a stellar top out. The first crux is most definitely getting established in the dihedral (be sure you're solid at the grade because the protection before getting established is unreliable at best), with a second through the thin crack.
content.protection: There is little to no gear until established in the dihedral. After that, make sure you get a solid 1.5 placement before moving up to the thinner crack. There is a bolted anchor (without rap rings) at the top for a TR.
content.location:
About 30 feet to the right of

Form 34

starts a cluster of harder routes.

content.description: This is the "easy way out." A scrambling start leads to a short crack, which is the 5.6 crux. The upper half is a mellow finish to the top. Watch out for loose rock.
content.location: This is the first route on the left of the wall. See the beta photo.

content.description: A good first lead for new cadet climbers, this climb navigates the low-angled, wide crack on the right side of the cliff. It's fairly sustained and fun!
content.protection: Good pro in the 2-3 range all the way.
content.location:
It is about 20 feet to the right of the

Behind Closed Doors

dihedral.

content.description:
5.12c/d? This has super thin face climbing on next-to-nothing holds.

The route received a free ascent on TR.
content.protection: It will be bolted soon. It is a toprope for now.
content.location:
It is on the face about 5 feet to the right of

Behind Closed Doors

.

content.description:
This is an excellent route that climbs the dihedral to the right of

Article 15

and the face above it. There is no pro above the dihedral (bolts to come soon), but the climbing is slabmazing. The crux is moving from the dihedral onto the face.
content.protection: None above the dihedral, be careful.
content.location:
It is just to the right of

Article 15

.

content.description:
This follows the wider crack just to the right of

Frat Hit

. It has consistent climbing all the way to the top! This is one of the best at Punishment Wall.
content.location:
It is just to the right of

Frat Hit

.
